Package playground

Class Playground

  • java.lang.Object
    • playground.Playground
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SpaceInvadersLevel
    public abstract class Playground
extends java.lang.Object
    Playground represents a level of the game, focussing on the game LOGIC and the graphical representation of the level itself (not its GameObject instances). In particular, an instance of Playground
    • manages the different moving or static objects in a level (e.g., collisions, adding objects, removing objects). This is mainly done by the methods addObject(gameobjects.GameObject), deleteObject(java.lang.String) and getObject(java.lang.String).
    • processes keyboard inputs provided by GameMain
    • represents the state of a level represented by flags. Each flag has a name (a String) and an arbitrary value of any type. Methods: setLevelFlag(java.lang.String, java.lang.Object), getLevelFlag(java.lang.String), setGlobalFlag(java.lang.String, java.lang.Object), getGlobalFlag(java.lang.String). As an example, the current score is a flag usually named "points", with an Integer as a value. This value can be retrieved and manipulated using the above mentioned methods.

      • collectObjects

        public java.util.LinkedList<GameObject> collectObjects​(java.lang.String substr,
                                                       boolean filterInactive)
        Search all game objects for objects with a certain substring in their name. USEFUL!
        Parameters:
        substr - String. The string that must be part of the object name if object is to be considered found.
        filterInactive - deprecated, does nothing regardless of value
        Returns:
        a reference to a LinkedList filled with all objects that have substr in thier name

        Parameters:
        id - String The unique identifier of the object

        Removes a graphics object from a level immediately, NOT recommended.

      • getObject

        public GameObject getObject​(java.lang.String id)
        Retrieves a graphics object by name.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        reference to the requested game object, or null if not found

      • setGlobalFlag

        public static void setGlobalFlag​(java.lang.String flag,
                                 java.lang.Object value)
        Sets a game-wide permanent flag. This will be prefixed by "/global" but you will never need to put this directly, because the getGlobalFlag(java.lang.String) method also add this automatically.
        Parameters:
        flag - String Q unique name in this level. If it exists value is overwritten.
        value - Object Any Object can be the value of a flag!

      • setLevelFlag

        public java.lang.Object setLevelFlag​(java.lang.String flag,
                                     java.lang.Object value)
        Sets a level-wide permanent flag.
        Parameters:
        flag - String Q unique name in this level. If it exists value is overwritten.
        value - Object Any Object can be the value of a flag!
        Returns:
        the value that was just set

      • resetFlags

        public void resetFlags​(int mode)
        Deletes all flags.
        Parameters:
        mode - Can be: FLAGS_ALL (all), FLAGS_GLOBAL(global), FLAGs_LEVEL(level)

      • getGlobalFlag

        public static java.lang.Object getGlobalFlag​(java.lang.String flag)
        Retrieves a game-wide flag by name.
        Parameters:
        flag - String Unique flag id
        Returns:
        the value associated with flag, or null if the flag does not exist.

      • getOrCreateGlobalFlag

        public static java.lang.Object getOrCreateGlobalFlag​(java.lang.String flag,
                                                     java.lang.Object value)
        Retrieves a game-wide flag by name. If it does not exist, it is created.
        Parameters:
        flag - String Unique flag id
        value - Default value for the flag to be vreated if it does not exist.
        Returns:
        the value associated with flag

      • getLevelFlag

        public java.lang.Object getLevelFlag​(java.lang.String flag)
        Retrieves a level-wide flag by name. If it does not exist, retuns null
        Parameters:
        flag - String Unique flag id
        Returns:
        the value associated with flag, or null.

      • redrawLevel

        public abstract void redrawLevel​(java.awt.Graphics2D g2)
        To be redefined!! Draws mainly h level background and global information like points etc.
        Parameters:
        g2 - Graphics2D abstract drawing object of java Swing, used to carry out all drawing operations.

      • prepareLevel

        public abstract void prepareLevel​(java.lang.String level)
        Sets up a single level. Prepares all objects etc. Is called ONCE at the start of each level by the game engine.
        Parameters:
        level - String a string identifying the level number etc
